Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: T_4phage that carrymutations in the genomic region calledrII cancause thelysisof strain B of E. coli but not of E. coli strainK. A plate of E. coli strain B is infected by two types of mutantphage simultaneously. The resultinglysateis divided inhalf. Half is diluted 1:10^7 and plated onto a lawn of E. coli strainB. The other half is diluted 1:10^5 and plated on strain K. Four plaques are found on K and 40 are found on B. A. 1 percent

B. 2 percent

C. 1.5 percent

D. 0.1 percent

E. 0.2 percent

F. 0.3 percent

G. 0.5 percent

H. 5 percent

I. 0.02 percent

J. 0.05 percent

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

But when both types are present, the E. coli strain B is mostly affected, which suggests some kind of interaction or recombination between them. After incubation, there were 4 plumes on K and 40 on B. Wait, actually, since these are phages, each plume represents an infection event. I. 0.02 percent

A plate of E. coli strain B is infected by two types of mutantphage simultaneously. The resultinglysateis divided inhalf. Half is diluted 1:10^7 and plated onto a lawn of E. coli strainB. The other half is diluted 1:10^5 and plated on strain K. Four plaques are found on K and 40 are found on B. B. 2 percent

C. 1.5 percent

D. 0.1 percent

E. 0.2 percent

F. 0.3 percent

G. 0.5 percent

H. 5 percent

I. 0.02 percent

J. 0.05 percent

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

F. 0.3 percent

G. 0.5 percent

I. 0.02 percent

J. 0.05 percent

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

A plate of E. coli strain B is infected by two types of mutantphage simultaneously. The resultinglysateis divided inhalf. Half is diluted 1:10^7 and plated onto a lawn of E. coli strainB. The other half is diluted 1:10^5 and plated on strain K. Four plaques are found on K and 40 are found on B. B. 2 percent

C. 1.5 percent

D. 0.1 percent

E. 0.2 percent

F. 0.3 percent

G. 0.5 percent

H. 5 percent

I. 0.02 percent

J. 0.05 percent

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

<|im_start|>user
Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: T_4phage that carrymutations in the genomic region calledrII cancause thelysisof strain B of E. coli but not of E. coli strainK. A plate of E. coli strain B is infected by two types of mutantphage simultaneously. The resultinglysateis divided inhalf. Half is diluted 1:10^7 and plated onto a lawn of E. coli strainB. The other half is diluted 1:10^5 and plated on strain K. Four plaques are found on K and 40 are found on B. Determine the amount of recombination between the two mutationsin this region of the T_4 genome.

A. 1 percent

B. 2 percent

C. 1.5 percent

D. 0.1 percent

E. 0.2 percent
